message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try { output.write(msg + "\n"); output.flush(); } catch (IOException e) { System.err.println("Unable to write message because of an unhandled IOException: " + e.getMessage()); }
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are writing the command to the output stream but you are not flushing the stream. The flush() method in Java is used to flush the stream. It flushes the stream by writing any buffered output bytes to the underlying output stream. Also, you need to add a newline character at the end of your command because the console application expects it.
